result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky Lamont Harrison Jr.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
ec: DA and Atty De La Rosa (10/18/22--ma)
STIPULATION TO ADJOURN CHANGE OF PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 11:08am 
Defendant Ricky Lamont Harrison Jr. in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney De La Rosa believes the parties have a resolution; he requests the scheduling of another hearing date.
recess 11:11am 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on October 20th at 2:30pm
Pre-trial conference on June 29, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 9:40AM
Defendant Ricky Lamont Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to both charges
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 9:44AM

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 06/29 at 3:40PM with counsel appearances only   (2) Status Conference on 07/29 at 10:30AM with in person appearances

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 11:06 AM Defendant Ricky Lamont Harrison in court.  ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:10 am
NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 6/9/22 at 9:30 am
